result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin L Costanzo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin L Costanzo

Defendant Dustin L Costanzo in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State moves to dismiss 15CF1221 because the State cannot meet their burden. Parties have received the PSI in 14CF1058. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. 

BTC: 15CF1221 is dismissed w/o prejudice In 14CF1058, 45 days RCJ/CFTS. DNA sample & costs. FAW/vote. IS eligible for CIP and SAP.
